headline: Bubbles and Boring Bets: What’s Coming for Tech Stocks in 2026
summary: While tech giants like Alphabet Inc. and Nvidia Corp. delivered strong gains, unsung corners of the industry, like memory chips and hard disk drives, proved to be far better places for investors.  With the bull market in US stocks stretching into a fourth year, there are more concerns than ever about the sustainability of heavy spending on AI computing and whether the returns will justify the investments.

content.title: Bubbles and Boring Bets: What’s Coming for Tech Stocks in 2026
content.summary: While tech giants like Alphabet Inc. and Nvidia Corp. delivered strong gains, unsung corners of the industry, like memory chips and hard disk drives, proved to be far better places for investors.  With the bull market in US stocks stretching into a fourth year, there are more concerns than ever about the sustainability of heavy spending on AI computing and whether the returns will justify the investments.

headline: Tesla Bull Calls 2026 An 'Inflection Year' For Rivian With The Stock At Its Highest Since January 2024
summary: Rivian has been on a hot-streak since its "Autonomy & AI Day," where the EV startup announced an in-house silicon AI chip and outlined its next-generation AI platform.  In addition, a longtime Tesla bull raised his RIVN price target, calling 2026 an "inflection year" for the brand.  Wedbush Securities analyst Dan Ives on Friday hiked his Rivian stock price target to 25 from 16, maintaining his outperform rating on the shares.

headline: Does Trump Media’s Merger With TAE Make It Kodak or Something Else? Lessons From History.
summary: Yes, we are talking about the merger between social-media platform  Trump Media & Technology  and nuclear fusion start-up TAE Technologies.  The deal values TAE at some $3 billion, creating the world’s first publicly traded nuclear fusion company, which produces energy the way a star does.  Trump Media stock added 41.9% closing at $14.86 on Thursday, while the  and  rose 0.7% and 0.1%, respectively.

headline: Morgan Stanley seen as front-runner for SpaceX IPO, sources say
summary: Morgan Stanley is emerging as a leading contender for a key role in SpaceX's blockbuster initial public offering, as the bank's close ties to CEO Elon Musk give it an edge in his decision, according to three people familiar with the matter.  A selection process, ​or "bake-off," for the IPO is still underway, with a select group of banks, including Morgan Stanley, Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan, vying for roles, four people familiar with the matter said, ‌adding that there is no certainty Morgan Stanley will secure the coveted "lead left" underwriting position, the sources said.  Musk's ties to Morgan Stanley run deep, dating back at least 15 years, leaving it widely viewed as the leading contender to run the syndicate ‌of underwriters, three of the people said, though no banks have been selected yet and the discussions remain fluid.

content.title: Morgan Stanley seen as front-runner for SpaceX IPO, sources say
content.summary: Morgan Stanley is emerging as a leading contender for a key role in SpaceX's blockbuster initial public offering, as the bank's close ties to CEO Elon Musk give it an edge in his decision, according to three people familiar with the matter.  A selection process, ​or "bake-off," for the IPO is still underway, with a select group of banks, including Morgan Stanley, Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan, vying for roles, four people familiar with the matter said, ‌adding that there is no certainty Morgan Stanley will secure the coveted "lead left" underwriting position, the sources said.  Musk's ties to Morgan Stanley run deep, dating back at least 15 years, leaving it widely viewed as the leading contender to run the syndicate ‌of underwriters, three of the people said, though no banks have been selected yet and the discussions remain fluid.

headline: Big 3 automakers scaling back EV plans for 2026

headline: Musk wins appeal and restores 2018 Tesla pay deal worth $56 billion
summary: Elon Musk's 2018 pay package from Tesla, once worth $56 billion, was restored by the Delaware Supreme Court on Friday, two years after a lower court struck ​down the compensation deal as "unfathomable."  The ruling overturns a decision that had prompted a furious backlash from ‌Musk and damaged Delaware's business-friendly reputation.  The pay package was by far the largest ever until Tesla shareholders approved a new, even larger pay plan ‌in November.

content.title: Musk wins appeal and restores 2018 Tesla pay deal worth $56 billion
content.summary: Elon Musk's 2018 pay package from Tesla, once worth $56 billion, was restored by the Delaware Supreme Court on Friday, two years after a lower court struck ​down the compensation deal as "unfathomable."  The ruling overturns a decision that had prompted a furious backlash from ‌Musk and damaged Delaware's business-friendly reputation.  The pay package was by far the largest ever until Tesla shareholders approved a new, even larger pay plan ‌in November.

headline: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's 2018 pay package reinstated by court
summary: The Delaware Supreme Court has restored Tesla (TSLA) CEO Elon Musk's 2018 pay package valued at $56 billion. This all comes after Tesla board members agreed on a $1 trillion pay package pending if the EV maker hits certain performance targets and milestones in the coming years. Asking for a Trend host Jared Blikre reports on the breaking news. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend.

headline: Elon Musk’s $56B Tesla pay package restored by Delaware Supreme Court
summary: The decision brings to a close a years-long court battle that irked Musk so much he moved Tesla's incorporation from Delaware to Texas.

content.title: Elon Musk’s $56B Tesla pay package restored by Delaware Supreme Court
content.summary: The decision brings to a close a years-long court battle that irked Musk so much he moved Tesla's incorporation from Delaware to Texas.

headline: Tesla Wins Final Court Fight Over Elon Musk’s Pay Package
summary: Tesla  won its fight over a record-breaking pay package for Chief Executive  Elon Musk  that was approved by shareholders in 2018.  An opinion from the Delaware Supreme Court issued Friday ends the yearslong legal battle over compensation that grew in value to total more than $126 billion.  The court reversed the 2024 decision from Delaware’s Chancery Court to rescind Musk’s pay package after finding that Tesla’s directors were beholden to its CEO and that the approval process for the pay deal was tainted and lacked transparency.

content.title: Tesla Wins Final Court Fight Over Elon Musk’s Pay Package
content.summary: Tesla  won its fight over a record-breaking pay package for Chief Executive  Elon Musk  that was approved by shareholders in 2018.  An opinion from the Delaware Supreme Court issued Friday ends the yearslong legal battle over compensation that grew in value to total more than $126 billion.  The court reversed the 2024 decision from Delaware’s Chancery Court to rescind Musk’s pay package after finding that Tesla’s directors were beholden to its CEO and that the approval process for the pay deal was tainted and lacked transparency.

headline: Musk wins appeal that restores 2018 Tesla pay deal now worth about $155 billion
summary: Elon Musk's 2018 pay package from Tesla, once worth $56 billion, was restored by the Delaware Supreme Court on Friday, two years after a lower court struck down the compensation deal as "unfathomable."  The ruling overturns ​a decision that had prompted a furious backlash from Musk and damaged Delaware's business-friendly reputation.  The court said a judge's rescission of the pay package in 2024 had been "inequitable."

content.title: Musk wins appeal that restores 2018 Tesla pay deal now worth about $155 billion
content.summary: Elon Musk's 2018 pay package from Tesla, once worth $56 billion, was restored by the Delaware Supreme Court on Friday, two years after a lower court struck down the compensation deal as "unfathomable."  The ruling overturns ​a decision that had prompted a furious backlash from Musk and damaged Delaware's business-friendly reputation.  The court said a judge's rescission of the pay package in 2024 had been "inequitable."

content.summary: Investing.com -- Elon Musk won reinstatement of his 2018 pay package as chief executive of Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) after the Delaware Supreme Court reversed a lower court ruling on Friday.

headline: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's 2018 Pay Package Must Be Reinstated, Court Rules
summary: The Delaware Supreme Court overturned a lower court decision that had rescinded Tesla CEO Elon Musk's 2018 pay package, ruling that was too harsh.

headline: Elon Musk gets his $139 billion pay package from 2018 restored after a yearslong battle with a Delaware judge
summary: The Delaware Supreme Court has restored a massive pay package awarded to Tesla CEO Elon Musk in 2018 that had twice been voided by a lower court judge.

content.title: Elon Musk gets his $139 billion pay package from 2018 restored after a yearslong battle with a Delaware judge
content.summary: The Delaware Supreme Court has restored a massive pay package awarded to Tesla CEO Elon Musk in 2018 that had twice been voided by a lower court judge.

thumbnail.caption: Tesla CEO Elon Musk had a pay package worth $139 billion restored by the Delaware Supreme Court late Friday. - Hamad I Mohammed/Reuters

headline: Musk Wins Reinstatement of His 2018 Pay Package as CEO
summary: Elon Musk won reinstatement of his 2018 pay package as chief executive of Tesla, after the Delaware Supreme Court reversed the finding of a judge who said the billionaire had improperly influenced board members who came up with the compensation plan. Jonathan Levin has more on "Bloomberg The Close."

headline: Elon Musk’s massive 2018 Tesla pay package restored by Delaware court

headline: Tesla Stock Falls Despite Wild 2026 Prediction From Bull
summary: A forecast that the company could have robo-taxis in 30 cities by the end of next year lifted the share price early on Friday.

content.title: Tesla Stock Falls Despite Wild 2026 Prediction From Bull

headline: Musk wins appeal that restores 2018 Tesla pay deal now worth about $139 billion
summary: Elon Musk's 2018 pay package from Tesla, once worth $56 billion, was restored by the Delaware Supreme Court on Friday, two years after a lower court struck down the compensation deal as "unfathomable."  The ruling overturns ​a decision that had prompted a furious backlash from Musk and damaged Delaware's business-friendly reputation.  The court said a 2024 ruling that ‌rescinded the pay package had been improper and inequitable to Musk.
